greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Starting with a(1) = a(2) = 1, proceed in a square spiral, computing each term as the sum of diagonally adjacent prior terms.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Peter Kagey, Bitmap illustrating the of parity of the first 2^22 terms. (Even and odd numbers are represented with black and white pixels respectively.)
example: The last illustrated term above is a(35) = 3 = 2 + 1 because diagonally down-right is 2 and diagonally down-left is 1.
xref: The x- and y-coordinates at n-th step are A174344 and A274923 respectively.
results.author: _Alec Jones_ and _Peter Kagey_, May 09 2020
